name: April 21 -- Happy Birthday, Ma'am Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which American actress, born on this day in 1958, made her film debut as Tarzan's love interest, Jane Porter, in the 1984 film "Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes"?
questions.explanation:
Andie MacDowell.

	Andie McDowell played Jane opposite Christopher Lambert in 1984. Bo Derek (born in 1956) had played her opposite Miles O'Keeffe's Tarzan in 1981. Kim Crosby (born in 1960) is primarily known as a singer, but she played Jane opposite Joe Lara in 1989. Minne Driver (born in 1970) provided the voice for the animated Jane in a Disney animated version in 1999.

questions.text: Which singer, songwriter and musician was born James Newell Osterberg Jr in Muskegon MI on this date in 1947?
questions.explanation:
Iggy Pop.

	Iggy Pop's musical career began as a drummer for a high school band named 'The Iguanas', which is where the name originated. Joey Ramone, lead singer of The Ramones, was born Jeffry Ross Hyman in Queens NY in 1951. Alice Cooper was also a Michigan native, born Vincent Damon Furnier in Allen Park MI in 1948. Ronnie James Dio, who took over from Ozzy Osbourne as the leader of Black Sabbath, was born Ronald James Padavona in Portsmouth NH in 1942.

questions.text: Who was the German sociologist and political economist born on this date in 1864?
questions.explanation:
Max Weber.

	Born Karl Emil Maximilian Weber in Erfurt in Prussian Saxony, his works on the rise of capitalism have made him one of the most important writers in modern social sciences. Karl Marx was born in Trier, Prussia in 1818. Friedrich Engels was born in Barmen, Prussia in 1820. Émile Durkheim, a contemporary of Weber and acknowledged as the 'father of modern sociology', was French, born in Epinal in 1858.

questions.text: Although undrafted out of Eastern Illinois in 2003, which NFL quarterback has posted a QB rating that is in the top five of all time in the five years following his debut in 2006?
questions.explanation:
Tony Romo.

	Antonio Ramiro Romo was born in San Diego CA on this date in 1980. Since taking over from Drew Bledsoe as QB for the Dallas Cowboys, Romo has smashed numerous club records. His 25 300+ passing yards easily eclipses Troy Aikman's previous record of 13. His 36 passing TDs in 2007 eclipsed the club's previous record of 29 by Danny White. He is the only Cowboys' QB ever to throw for more than 4,000 yards in a season, and he has done it twice (2007 and 2009).

questions.text: Which British actor, born on this date in 1979, won the Empire Award for Best Actor in 2005 for "The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe" and in 2007 for "Atonement"?
questions.explanation:
James McAvoy.

	James Andrew McAvoy, born in Port Glasgow, Scotland on this date in 1979, also won the London Film Critics Circle Award for British Actor of the Year for "Atonement". In 2006, he won the 'Rising Star' award at the BAFTAs for his performance in "The Last King of Scotland". He is married to actress Anne-Marie Duff, alongside whom he appeared in the British TV series "Shameless".The alternatives are also Empire Award Best Actor winners or nominees. Andy Serkis, best known as Gollum in the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy, was born in London in 1964. Ewan McGregor was born in Perth, Scotland in 1971. Christian Bale was born in Haverfordwest, Wales in 1974.

questions.text: Which British author, knighted in 1998, was born on this date in 1923?
questions.explanation:
John Mortimer.

	John Clifford Mortimer, born in Hampstead in 1923, is best known as the creator of 'Rumpole of the Bailey', frequently played on screen by Leo McKern. Mortimer died at the age of 85 in 2009. Alexander McCall Smith, the creator of the "No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency" series, was born in Rhodesia in 1948. Playwright Alan Bennett was born in Leeds in 1934. Novelist H E Bates CBE, (writer of 'The Darling Buds of May') was born in Northamptonshire in 1905.

questions.text: Which actor, born on this date in 1951, starred on TV as Tony Banta in 'Taxi' and Tony Micelli in 'Who's the Boss?'?
questions.explanation:
Tony Danza.

	Anthony Salvatore Iadanza was born in Brooklyn NY on this date in 1951. He appeared in the 1997 remake of '12 Angry Men' as Juror #7, the role played in 1957 by Jack Warden. (Jack Lemmon played Henry Fonda's Juror #8 role.)Danny Pintauro, born in 1976, was one of Danza's co-stars in 'Who's the Boss?' Danny DeVito, born in Neptune NJ in 1944, played Louie De Palma in 'Taxi'. Christopher Lloyd, born in Stamford CT in 1938, played Reverend Jim Ignatowski in 'Taxi'.

questions.text: The first girl born into the Danish royal family in more than 60 years was born on this date in 2007. What is the first name of the princess who became third in line to the Danish throne?
questions.explanation:
Isabella.

	Princess Isabella, Countess of Monpezat, was born Isabella Henrietta Ingrid Margrethe of Denmark, the daughter of Crown Prince Frederik and his Australian-born wife, Crown Princess Mary. The fourth grandchild (and oldest granddaughter) of Queen Margrethe II, she is behind her father and her older brother, Prince Christian, in line for the Danish throne.

questions.text: Actor Anthony Quinn, born on this date in 1915, was born in which country?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	Quinn was born Antonio Rodolfo Quinn Oaxaca in Chihuahua, Mexico. He starred in blockbusters such "Zorba the Greek", "Lawrence of Arabia" and "The Guns of Navarone". He twice won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor, for "Viva Zapata!" in 1952 and for "Lust for Life" in 1956. He died aged 86 in 2001.

questions.text: Born on this date in 1816, who wrote under the pseudonym Currer Bell?
questions.explanation:
Charlotte Bronte.

	The eldest of the three Bronte sisters, Charlotte was born on this date in Thornton, Yorkshire, England. The first and easily the best known of her novels, 'Jane Eyre', appeared under the pen name of Currer Bell when it was first published in 1847.
